title: The Dark Side of Policy Learning: Analysis of Value-Destruction Mechanisms [K-12]

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Policy Analysis and Public Administration Concepts, Intermediate-Level Social Science Background
context.additional_context: Course cultivating critical thinking about potential negative outcomes in policy learning for general citizens, involving case analysis and project execution using digital devices (laptops/tablets)

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish between two types of policy learning failures (design errors/normative errors) and explain them through real-world cases.
Learners can analyze public value destruction mechanisms at the levels of public value (principles) and public value (service outcomes).
Learners can develop a criteria framework to evaluate intentional/unintentional value destruction cases occurring during the policy learning process.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
